post: The Bill of Rights Institute has a new way to give and its as easy as Click. Travel. GIVE! BRI has partnered with TravelingToGive, a smart trip-planning tool that gives back to teachers and students. By using our travel booking tool, you can make a direct impact on civic education. Visit the link and plan your first trip now. Every trip you take gives back to BRI!  https://lnkd.in/eNRSQW2C.  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #travelingtogive

Looking for another way to support civic education? At the Bill of Rights Institute, we are proud to partner with organizations and companies that support civic educationand Federal Flags, LLC wants to give back to the same cause you support. When you purchase a flag using the code 'BRI,' Federal Flags will donate a portion of each sale to support the Bill of Rights Institute and civic education. Visit  https://lnkd.in/eZ_NjqFR.  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #civiceducation

BRI is committed to ensuring that all students have access to a quality civic education. That's why we are proud to receive support from TranslateLive, an organization dedicated to providing accessible and inclusive resources. Thank you Translate Live for your support!  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI

Happy National Intern Day! The Bill of Rights Institute wants to thank our interns for all their hard work! We are grateful for Elizabeth Hancox, our programs intern, and Sellers Shockley, our K-8 content intern. Joining us today is former development intern, Katherine Reback. BRI's internship programs for college students and recent graduates provide hands-on professional experience in a continuous learning environment. For more information on our internships, visit  https://lnkd.in/en2uEvnA.  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #NationalInternDay

Some of the most talented civics and history students in America traveled to Philadelphia and Washington, D. C., earlier this month to explore civics, democracy, and Americas unique story. The week was the capstone event for the Bill of Rights Institutes elite Student Fellowship program, a six-month educational program that helps high school students develop as leaders and develop skills in building civil society. The Student Fellows enjoyed a robust itinerary in Philadelphia and Washington, D. C., during their trip. Each day incorporated specific themes, including leadership and the roles of government, the individual, and the entrepreneur in civil society. To learn more about the fellowship, visit  https://lnkd.in/gm59gU3W.  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #StudentFellowship

Benjamin Franklin and Abraham Lincoln have a new home at the Bill of Rights Institute – thanks to the generosity of Print & Graphic Communications Association in support of the Power of the Printed Word Initiative! The Print & Graphic Communications Association, which represents the printing and graphics industry for New York state, New Jersey, Pennsylvania and Delaware, recently donated a more than 100-year-old bust of Franklin and a 125-year-old piece of stone lithography artwork depicting Lincoln to BRIs headquarters. To read more about their generous donations, visit  https://lnkd.in/ee2NUT42. The Power of the Printed Word Initiative ensures every student has access to a pocket Constitution, fostering a generation of informed and engaged citizens. Interested in supporting? Visit  https://lnkd.in/eE-zWeup or connect with Justin Goldstein, CAE for more information!  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #PowerofthePrintedWord

We had the opportunity to catch up with Caroline Gao, the Grand Prize winner of BRI's 2023 MyImpact Challenge civic engagement contest. Listen to Caroline describe her nonprofit, The World in Us, a youth-to-youth cultural education organization, and the ways in which MyImpact Challenge helped her to connect concepts like citizenship skills and civic virtues to her work. These are foundational skills and ways of thinking that I dont think I would have internalized nearly as much as I have now if not for the MyImpact Challenge,  Gao said.  https://lnkd.in/ebyqpN3X. To support the MyImpact Challenge civic engagement contest, visit  https://lnkd.in/es_s-XFs  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #MyImpactChallenge

A MyImpact Challenge award winner provides free research training to high school students. Grace Liu turned her passion for academic research into an opportunity to help underrepresented populations have access to that same content. Liu, a student at Syosset High School in Syosset, N. Y., created Research to Empower (ReTE), a nonprofit organization that makes free research training available to all students – particularly students from underrepresented backgrounds. To read more about Grace Liu's organization, visit  https://lnkd.in/egKPeGFJ.  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #MyImpactChallenge

Welcome to the team, Chanell "Tico" Noise! Both an avid reader and adept problem-solver, Chanell joined BRI in 2024 as a Project Coordinator. With a diverse background spanning projects in live events and government contracts, she is ready to support our content team in their ongoing work to teach civics and history.  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #welcometotheteam
